alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 16 at 1:31PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 126 PM EDT, The Fort Fairfield Fire Department reported an ice jam in the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Flooding has subsided along the Aroostook near the Caribou town line. Grimes Road and the North Caribou Road at Strickland Road are now open. Minor flooding continues near Fort Fairfield and portions of Russell Road and Riverside Ave in Fort Fairfield remain closed. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Fairfield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Water levels can rise and fall quickly in the vicinity of ice jams. Those with interests along rivers and tributary streams should be alert for rapidly fluctuating water levels in the vicinity of ice jams. Never drive through flooded roads or around closed road barricades. The barricades are there for your safety due to the potential for ice jam releases or continued flooding.
